ci_support_linux_64_.yaml:
channel_sources:
- conda-forge
channel_targets:
- conda-forge main
docker_image:
- quay.io/condaforge/linux-anvil-x86_64:alma9
python_min:
- '3.10'

about.description:
The iwopy package is a meta package that provides interfaces to
other open-source Python optimization packages out there. It can
thus be understood as an attempt to provide the best of all worlds
when it comes to solving optimization problems with Python. All
the credit for implementing the invoked optimizers goes to the
original package providers.
about.summary: Fraunhofer IWES optimization tools in Python

about.description:
The iwopy package is a meta package that provides interfaces to
other open-source Python optimization packages out there. It can
thus be understood as an attempt to provide the best of all worlds
when it comes to solving optimization problems with Python. All
the credit for implementing the invoked optimizers goes to the
original package providers.
about.summary: Fraunhofer IWES optimization tools in Python

name: iwopy
raw_meta_yaml:
{% set name = "iwopy" %}
{% set version = "0.4.0" %}
{% set python_min = "3.10" %}

package:
  name: {{ name|lower }}
  version: {{ version }}

source:
  url: https://github.com/FraunhoferIWES/iwopy/archive/v{{ version }}.tar.gz
  sha256: 6f409dd1c8a0d854aca9db7e5dd6d4633b5f5355efacd532af4c476419f2bb39

build:
  noarch: python
  script: {{ PYTHON }} -m pip install . -vv --no-deps --no-build-isolation
  number: 0

requirements:
  host:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - setuptools
    - pip
  run:
    - python >={{ python_min }}
    - matplotlib-base
    - numpy
    - scipy

test:
  imports:
    - iwopy
  requires:
    - python {{ python_min }}
    - pip
    - pytest
    - pymoo
  source_files:
    - tests
  commands:
    - pip check
    - pytest tests

about:
  home: https://github.com/FraunhoferIWES/iwopy
  summary: Fraunhofer IWES optimization tools in Python
  description: |
    The iwopy package is a meta package that provides interfaces to
    other open-source Python optimization packages out there. It can
    thus be understood as an attempt to provide the best of all worlds
    when it comes to solving optimization problems with Python. All 
    the credit for implementing the invoked optimizers goes to the
    original package providers.
  license: MIT
  license_file: LICENSE

extra:
  recipe-maintainers:
    - SchmJo
